descriptionNullable:
### Context

Images of different labeled gemstones. Can the algorithm understand is it ruby, amethyst or emerald?   

### Content

This dataset contains 3,200+ images of different gemstones. The images are grouped into 87 classes which are already divided into train and test data. All images are in various sizes and are in .jpeg format.
As for gemstones I tried to include them in various shapes - round, oval, square, rectangle, heart.

This dataset is composed of two folders:  
1. `train (~56 MB)`: This file contains 87 subfolders and ~2,800 files in total. Each subfolder contains .jpeg images of different gemstones.  
2. `test (~8 MB)`: This file contains 87 subfolders and ~400 files in total. Each subfolder contains .jpeg images of different gemstones.  

### Acknowledgements

Most pictures were parsed from `minerals.net` and `www.rasavgems.com` websites. I do not own the images! I just collected them in one dataset. 😊 You can find this work on my [GitHub page](https://github.com/LSIND/Gemstones-Convolutional-Neural-Network): create dataset and split it to test and train folders.

### Inspiration

So can you guess is it ruby or garnet?

![Alexandrite](https://www.minerals.net/thumbnail.aspx?image=GemStoneImages/alexandrite-chrysoberyl-brazil-t.jpg&size=120)![Aquamarine](https://www.minerals.net/thumbnail.aspx?image=GemStoneImages/Aquamarine_trillion_cut-thb.jpg&size=120)![Citrine](https://www.minerals.net/thumbnail.aspx?image=GemStoneImages/CITRINE-cushion-thb.jpg&size=120)
title: Gemstones Images
subtitle: 87 classes of gemstones for classification
